results.title: Building belief. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University Film Library
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
Dorothy Heathcote continues her work with a class of nine and ten year old American children. Using drama to create focus and feeling, she poses three moral dilemmas, where the children are confronted with crises involving leadership, old-age, and death. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University Film Library

results.title: Building belief. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University Film Library
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
This film shows England’s outstanding drama educator, Dorothy Heathcote, working with nine and ten year old American children. She uses drama as a means of teaching social studies. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Building an education partnership through the School Community Development Program
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: A program designed to inform parents, teachers and community groups about the aims and objectves of the School Community Development Program. Highlights three case studies at Fitzroy, Ballarat and West Heidelberg.

results.title: Building an african village
results.brief_description: A short program which outlines a Community Aid Abroad project. Victorian school children learn from a group of visiting Africans the skills of mud brick building. Designed to promote positive images of Africa and its people.
results.description: A short program which outlines a Community Aid Abroad project. Victorian school children learn from a group of visiting Africans the skills of mud brick building. Designed to promote positive images of Africa and its people.

results.title: Building a set
results.creator_credit: Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds, Wesley Greene and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: From the designer’s plans, the carpenter and back stage crew build the set. Drawing an outline on the stage floor (so rehearsals can go on), the crew order material, build flats and complete platforms and other details.

results.title: Building a house
results.brief_description: The processes of constructing a ;small modern American home by mass-production methods - a tremendous advance in building technique when compared with piece-building methods.

results.title: Building a highway
results.brief_description: A survey of the role of highways in America’s system of transportation and the major processes of roadbuilding including: first surveying, cutting, scraping and levelling of the roadbed; assembling materials; mixing and dumping concrete; smoothing and finishing surface; necessary skills involved to ensure safe, well-built highways.

results.title: Build yourself a world H.S.
results.creator_credit: Richard Need, John R.F. Stewart and Stewart's Films
results.brief_description: Traces the evolution of civil engineering, from man’s first tools to the structures of today. Shows that the present day civil engineer designs his project not only as a functional structure but also to take its place in its surroundings
